result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron J Danek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: each count and any other sentence, with Huber.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, bail to apply, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Obtain/maintain employment, or provide verification for disability benefits.

No VIOLENT contact with victim and minor children, advised that the agent can increase level of no contact if there are violations of conditions of probation.
No Cohabitation until approved by court or agent.

Batterers Intervention program.
Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.

AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
With signed release forms defendant can use Pro Health programs for AODA and Mental conditions.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Aaron J Danek in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Additional statements by victim.
AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to each count and any other sentence, with credit for 1 DAY time served, with Huber.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 4
The court sentenced the defendant to 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to each count and any other sentence, with Huber.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 60 DAYS (as to each count) as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No VIOLENT contact with victim and minor children, advised that the agent can increase level of no contact if there are violations of conditions of probation.
-No Cohabitation until approved by court or agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment., or provide verification for disability benefits.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, bail to apply, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

*With signed release forms defendant can use Pro Health programs for AODA and Mental Health conditions.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

Defendant Aaron J Danek in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing. 
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 3
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court ordered Counts 1 & 3 Dismissed, but Read In.
AS TO COUNTS 2 & 4
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court VACATED Jury Trial date.
Received & Filed, Sentencing documents filed by defense. SEALED BY THE COURT.
Victim present in court requesting modification of the No Contact orders.  Court allowed for electronic and phone contact ONLY.  State stipulated to modification.

Defendant Aaron J Danek in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Final Pretrial held. Parties have reached a resolution of this matter and reqeust a Plea & Sentencing date prior to Jury Trial date of 6/24/2015.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Aaron J Danek in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called at 8:30 AM. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Aaron J Danek in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape#15-042

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  
Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  The case is adjourned to Branch 23 for a Pretrial Conference.
